definition: the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: Scorpions have unique sensory combs, called pectines, on their dorsal sides.
sentences.chinese: 蠍子的背側上長有一排被稱之爲櫛狀器的獨特感應梳。

sentences.english: Histologically, the mass lesion was diagnosed as a dorsally sequestered disc herniation.
sentences.chinese: 組織學檢查診斷出塊狀病變爲背側隱性椎間盤突出。

sentences.english: The ridges of the dorsal and ventral longitudinal columns extend inward respectively.
sentences.chinese: 纖維鞘的背側縱柱和腹側縱柱分別向內伸出一個嵴。

sentences.english: The right anterosuperior lobe was divided into the ventral and dorsal segments by the vertical intersegmental fissure.
sentences.chinese: 右前上葉依垂直段間裂分爲腹側和背側段。

sentences.english: Clearcut somatotopical localization was demonstrated in the oral part of the dorsal accessory olivary nucleus.
sentences.chinese: 在背側副撖欖核內有明確的體部定位關係。

sentences.english: The interossea dorsal nerve should be protected carefully.
sentences.chinese: 在分離蒂部血管時要注意保護好骨間背側神經。

sentences.english: Facet joints are pairs of small joints between the vertebrae in the back of the spine.
sentences.chinese: 關節突關節是位於脊柱背側兩個椎體間的一對小關節。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the dorsal approach to osteochondroma on the ventral surface of the scapula.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討肩胛骨腹側骨軟骨瘤背側手術入路的方法。
